intro: Grindelia robusta var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf gumweed, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland areas.
